note: The scale of the text is large and, by analogy with other de luxe late antique illustrated works (such as the Vatican Virgil), it is likely to have been laid out in single columns with images (outline drawings) arranged as column pictures and some perhaps as full-page miniatures. In the illustration on fol. 18r, only the heads of what would probably have been full-length standing figures remain, indicating the very large scale of the original page. The text in the Ottonian copy from Werden (now in Budapest) has two columns, but in smaller Carolingian minuscule script and was probably reconfigured

note.value: Description of undertext by Michelle P. Brown, David Ganz, Daniela Mairhofer
